events.event_description: U.S. imports of renewable diesel reached near-record levels, averaging 30,000 barrels per day with 94% destined for the West Coast.
events.citation: In the first five months of 2024, U.S. imports of renewable diesel averaged 30,000 barrels per day (b/d), approaching the monthly record set in May 2023. Most of the imports (94%) were destined for the U.S. West Coast, where most of the country's renewable diesel is consumed.

events.event_description: Neste completed expansion of its Singapore plant, increasing renewable diesel production capacity.
events.citation: The increase in imports was likely driven by increased: Production capacity at Neste's Singapore plant following its expansion in mid-2023

events.event_description: Los Angeles renewable diesel imports increased to 18,000 b/d due to expanded storage capacity at Vopak's terminal.
events.citation: So far in 2024, 18,000 b/d of the 30,000 b/d of imported renewable diesel have gone to Los Angeles, an increase from 2023's annual average of 13,000 b/d, according to our company-level import data. The increase in terminal capacity in Los Angeles has likely underpinned the growth in imports to that port in 2024.

events.event_description: Scheduled maintenance announced for Neste's Singapore and Rotterdam plants expected to decrease imports in second half of 2024.
events.citation: Although we forecast that more biodiesel and renewable diesel will be imported in 2024 than in previous years in our Short-Term Energy Outlook, we expect imports to decrease in the second half of the year in part because of scheduled maintenance at Neste's Singapore and Rotterdam plants.
